Review.Titre: My membership was cancelled only after…
Review.Contenu: My membership was cancelled only after using it for a week and no one informed me about it. And when I reached out to customer support they only told me that my membership is cancelled and they have refunded the money and when I asked for the reason for the cancellation again they told me that my money has been refunded. I do not think that this is the right way to treat a customer and leave them hanging in the middle without any proper explanation and apologies and on top of that I do not think that giving them a one or two-line answer is appropriate.On the other hand, I wanted to express my heartfelt appreciation for the incredible assistance the website has provided me with in crafting my resume.As I worked through the resume-building process, I was consistently impressed by the user-friendly interface and the comprehensive range of features available. The step-by-step guidance, resume templates, and content suggestions made the daunting task of creating a resume feel manageable and even enjoyable. The website's attention to detail and commitment to helping users present their skills and experiences in the best light truly set it apart.Moreover, the resume-writing tips and guides Kickresume offers have been invaluable in enhancing the overall quality of my resume.

Review.Contenu: Problems:1. 0 customer support. I've fired of two different issues around saving. Whatever their cloud storage provider is, has problems exporting. 2. Not a bad start. I like the import LinkedIn profile feature.However...Samples of real world resumes are limited. The AI "builder" needs a lot of help with the wording, word choice, writing. As a creative I don't think the AI has enough of a vocabulary for my industry.The biggest area of improvement is the need for MORE customization. Unfortunately user is locked into presets and templates that don't allow much in the way of formatting, style/look or design. I suppose it has to be that way for now.If anything Kickresume helps one get off their ass. It got me started/motivated to begin the loathsome task of writing a resume.One thing that's important to note is that HR and recruiters use scanning software for resume intake. The preferred document type is MS word doc. While companies accept other formats like PDF files, the scanning software doesn't always recognize these. So your submission will likely be neglected. I'm not sure if/how KickResume addresses this.I would probably ask for a refund, but it was fun to use all the features and see what it spits out. Again you will have to modify most of what the AI generates.

I've used KickResume off and on for the past few years, and I have to say that I can't recommend them further.This is for three main reasons:1. You don't get what you pay for. Yes, they have a variety of templates. Yes, there are a lot of visually appealing elements to the resume. But, frankly, over 80% of the resumes do not work with the extra fonts and adjustments without creating unnecessary overhangs, breaking words up without any actual basis (like leaving the last letter off of my name), and inconsistencies with branding between cover letter and resume templates (read: your name is all caps in one, but not the other).2. You pay for the templates and then lose access to them if you cancel your subscription. If I pay $19 dollars for access to premium templates, I should have permanent access to the resume with that template. If I try to change it, I should pay again - fine.  But charging me for a product that I can't access is wrong.3. The customer service is terrible. When I made a complaint about my problems with the resume templates, "Nika" (if that's even a real person) implied that my problems did warrant problem-solving because of a so-called new release.  In addition, she said that I didn't deserve a refund because of multiple downloads. As I pointed out to her, the problems occured when I downloaded the resumes. Ignorant of this problem, she did not respond.Also, as I have requested cancelation, I should not be charge for the next three months. KickResume has charged me, and I am not taking them to arbitration with my credit card company.By the way, a review of several of their positive reviews reveals that they use fake reviewers to up their positive score - good that they have time for this while not having time for customer service or product improvement.

I like resumes with some design flavor, as it's something appreciated on my field (software engineering; like colors, forms, icons and stuff).Sadly though, the available designs on premium are not a lot, so I had to stick with just one option that was nice for me. It'd be nice to have more designs available. Also, column configuration on a per "fill-in" item is not configurable, so you have to stick with either 1 or 2 columns depending on the template.Export does not allow you to change the design neither for further improvement, which was also a downer.Nevertheless, AI functionality and assisted creation experience is a breeze, which guarantees a more than optimal resume that can be used to reach the jobs you want

Review.Contenu: The design options does not let me sort work Ex sections. The AI program could do better in suggesting.Word exports does not give you the same look and feel when exported. I was hoping to edit the resume by exporting it in word.

Review.Titre: Great Tool. Could use a few improvements
Review.Contenu: Great tool with professional looking formats for resumes and cover letters. Would be great to have resumes and cover letters that come as a package with matching formats. Would also appreciate being able to change font size and being able to transport information to other templates without having to copy and paste all the information over.

Review.Titre: A good product and a much improved support
Review.Contenu: The resume builder is good and easy to use however their customer service is non-existent. I have lost access due to some issues with their integration with appleID and I have been bounced about between kickresume support and apple support. Its been 3 days and it has still not been resolved. Mind you I am a paid account user and this is the service I get.Updated*** After the initial hiccup with support I must say they have really come up on tops and been very proactive and helpful.

Review.Titre: I like it when I used it
Review.Contenu: I like it when I used it.  It gave me a nice design, but when I was finished and canceled my subscription they kept charging me.  I had to email to have them refund me and cancel.  I received an email that my subscription was canceled and refunded for November, but then they charged me again for December and January even though I have the email showing that they canceled it!

Review.Titre: Only Few Templates - Too Costly Package
Review.Contenu: First things first, Few Templates are good but for skills category instead of circles there are stars which are not interview standard, Like this there are many defects in other resumes, The only resume I use is the basic resume with Extra tabs. Am unhappy.

Review.Titre: Its Good but needs some adjustments
Review.Contenu: Its a good plataform that really helps you organice your info and show it in a good way.However it would be good if you could drag the info in the experiencie and studies field so when you add up new info you could reorganice the fields according to importance or chronologycally, with out having to erase all of them and rearrenge them manually having to create one by one.Also great feature of adding "traits" it really gives some edge, however i dont know why sometimes it would mix spanish and english while explaining some of the games and when showing the results and the end of each game

Easy to use. However, I do not need the service anymore. My only issue is that they can not be contacted by phone. I sent an email to cancel my membership today. So hopefully, I won’t be billed again next month for July.

Review.Titre: Great service! Just not good customer service
Review.Contenu: I was working with an hr special and she told me about the site and got me started. I paid monthly for 3 months and still hadn’t found the right job, so I then decided to pay for a year in case I was working but wanted to apply for other position. This part I found annoying, after I paid for a year then they sent me a 30% off coupon to use on a year membership. When I asked customers service if the could credit or do anything for me they said NO. Kinda annoyed but do love how easy they make doing and adjusting my resume. Just pay for the year.

Hi,It might be 4 or 5 stars but there are things to be revised, ı think.Firstly, if you write for example (5 years experience), the ")" can not be viewed. It looks so on final copy (5 years experienceSecondly, when I try to open the pdf resume on Photoshop, the format looks corrupted. I don't know why.Thirdly, and maybe most important: Editing capability is weak. There are some other templates that I liked but I couldn't use them just because one of the section I have in resume is sticked to side area converselyt to other template. I can not simply change the positions of sections. You defined which is going to be on side bar, which is not.Also I can not highlight an area or title. Everything is defined formerly by you. Briefly, your software is like IOS, but I need an Android to make my own style resume.
(-) Not many templates(-) Not enough customization, specialy with spaces within each template(+) Good value for money

Review.Titre: It is ok for a quick resume
Review.Contenu: It is a good platform to do a quick resume but you don't have many options for customizations.

Review.Titre: The tool would have been more effective …
Review.Contenu: The tool would have been more effective if there was an option to change the sizes of different elements.
It's so very expensive to make a resume here.

Review.Titre: Average to Good…with room to be GREAT…
Review.Contenu: From my personal experience, I have had frustratstion with the limited character space with "open text" sections when filling in job descriptions. However, I was impressed with the responsiveness & the "fix" that was put in place fairly quickly to remedy that particular issue.  Before purchasing any resume subscription, as there are so many to choose from, it came down to Kick, CV Maker, Slash CV, Canva, Cake resume, and the free options I looked at, Realtime CV, crystal resume, Enhancecv, & JOBCV.me all have great options and different formats along with many great templates and ways to be more innovative and creative to "stand out". However, for my immediate needs right now in the job market and the business I am in, Kickresume seemed at the time to best suit my needs, as I first heard about it through Product Hunt. First, I am impressed with the response from the development team when it comes to issues that arise with your users, that is the MOST CRITICAL variable when I sign up for site services like these. So, that is a huge plus, & not just the fact that the team responds when a user reach's out, they actually look into the issue and try to have a "fix" in place or help the customer out if it's a "user" issue and not a software/code problem.-Overall, the templates are good, the font choices are enough to get just about any look you want and all look good in text/resume formats.* What would make it GREAT!- Something that many many job seekers struggle with are gaps in work history, and the formats that you currently have, although you may not understand this, when the "JOB TITLE" and the Dates of that particular job are spread way way far apart on the page, it draws the eye, and attention to the recruiter, or hiring manager/compnay to this gap. So, you really only have 2 templates that somewhat mitigate this "appearance". The "Green" template which lists the job title, city/area, and then the dates right beneath, but highlights the job title in what ever color the user wants, which put the city/area and date in black right underneath, in affect, putting more focus on the title and vs the dates and city/region/area.  This may seem very trivial or something that users don't care about, but….. it is a BIG BIG deal because recruiters quickly scan resumes for a total of about 10 to 15 seconds, and when the date of a job is way way on the other side of the page, (isolated) away from the job title and city, this in a way puts BLINKING lights around a user that potentially only at a particular company/job/position for a short time, but it was significant because of the skill set or crtitcal networking/relationships/knowledge the candidate gained in the role, even though it was for a short time.  So, even though this may seem like a NON-ISSUE with your templates, it's actually a huge issue.  Had I known that I would not be able to manipulate the arrangement of how the: Job Title, Dates, City/region,  could be layed out on each job position section, (becuase of the industry I am in) I would have went with another site.Having the Job Title above the text description, or to the very left of the page, then have the dates of that position all the way over to the right of the page for that job, really is a huge problem and disadvantage for job seekers, applicants that want recruiters and companies to focus on the job description and skill sets, and not IMMEDIATELY have their eyes drawn over to the dates that particular job was held.So, because of this… I am limited to just 1 template, maybe one other because of this, which SUCKS!  I think this could be an easy fix, in giving the user the option to format how they want the job title, city/area, dates, etc formatted, or at the very least, being able to put the job title and dates all on one line. You guys have created some creative and eye catching templates which I am not able to take advantage of any of them due to this.Next - I catagorize your templates into basically only 2 versions; the one pager version where everything reads from left to right down the page, like reading an article.The 2nd version; is the 2 column version, which is split down the middle creating 2 sides of the page. This version (2 column version) is visually a wonderful idea, eye catching & a great way to get a 2 pg resume down to one if a recruiter or a web site won't upload a 2 pg document (which happens a lot). HOWEVER - this particular 2 column format looses it's effectiveness and utility for the thousands of workers, who work in industries that require more of a "sentence, story structure" for their job descriptions, vs. the job seekers/applicants who can simply use quick bullet points. For those people only needing to bullet out a quick few highlights per job, this 2 column format works nicely.  BUT, for everyone else who needs to type actual text, and not "Bullet" points, this format really looks horrible, and makes it difficult to read, especially if it's a 2 pg resume.However, if there was a way, for the user who wants to take advantage of all the 2 column templates your site has created, having the ability to widen the job description text box, or adjust the overall margins (right, left, top, bottom) would allow all the users that need to type in text, (not just quick bullet points) the freedom to use these 2 column templates your site designed.  Even just making the adjustment for a specific job description to fit on 1 column and not get pushed over to the right side column or even the next page, making is difficult to read and follow. Another additional or "tweak" that would GREATLY improve the templates you have (which 80% of them I can't use) is to have the functionality to minimize the Wasted Space at the top of the resume where the Name, contact info, e-mail, etc is placed.  Almost 99% of people in the healthcare/medical/research/pharma/etc sector of business DO NOT EVER USE PICTURES on their resume. Many of the templates have that option (which is great), however for all those thousands of users who will NEVER put their pictures on a resume, having the ability to shrink down that portion of the resume at the very top, or even to upload an image from another template that you have already used on your other pre-formated templates, almost like taking what you guys have already designed, and giving the user the ability to replace the area on the resume that is for a picture, and being able to place another formatted design that has already been created on another template.  OR - (What other resume sites are doing that is AWESOME), for all your customers/users that do not use photographs on their resumes, having the ability to design a quick "logo" or "monogram" of their initials, with some (pre-designed) options and colors a customer can choose from. You guys have in a way, essentially done a version of this with the "Ladder" template, which takes your intials, places them in a circle with an X in the circle, first & last initial on right & left.This is a great template I have wanted to use, however because of the job title, city/region/ and then the date beign all the way on the right side of the section, I cannot use this template.In addition, when choosing this template, along with a few others like, Rectangular, (Especially "Blurred") Pipeline, Doodle, Vegan, Dotts and Polygon, there is SO MUCH WASTED SPACE after the personal info header.  These templates are really fantastic and creative, but the amount of wasted space makes them totally unuseable for all the customers and users needing to type more text & content vs. bullets. If there was a way for the user to have an option to still use these great templates, but minimize the graphics, make them a bit smaller in scale for the page, push the top and bottom margins further up or down so the graphics could be thinner, almost like a border, instead of taking up almost 2 inches of the top 1/2 of the page, it would make a HUGE difference for all the customers that deciding to go with other resume sites instead of kick resume, becuase they have the options to take exsisting templates/graphics/pictures/monograms/symbols/ and size them just a bit smaller or bigger to fit their own needs. Polygon is a great example of this, the bottom graphic design is a much thinner line, giving a nice pop of color, but not OVERWHELMING the overall appearance.  Polygon is wonderful template, but because the user does not have any ability at all to shrink down the top colored graphics that in some instances for certain professional fields, is too too much, but it's still a great design if the user could just make is smaller, or even shift it to the left or right side, same with Blurred and Pipeline, great design, but no way to shrink it, so that it is "scaled" to be in proportion with the overall resume's look, (which many customers need). Another tweak - the way the "Strenghts & Skills" section is formatted. this is a OUTSTANDING idea (especially in the industries I mentioned above), however having other options that would Print and look cleaner with regards to the "strengths" section when the user can type in select words or phrases, then all those words get formatted into a "square" with rounded corners.  On a computer screen, this format looks very impressive….. BUT not so much when printed. Many of the templates you have designed, when using a darker color, this section makes the actual "box" that your word and/or phrase goes in very very dark, sometimes black, and your word/phrase "white"…this DOES NOT PRINT WELL.  Having a very more options around design, or format with the "Strenghts/skills" section and how it an be formated or designed on the page would really be huge.  The "Circle or Dots" design is fine, but not for a user wanting to list out just "words".  Having the ability to potenitally put: different symbols by each word in a variety of colors, No more room 4 comments...

The templates are great, intro done by AI is pretty good for the job description if you start with a fresh resume, however the paragraph rewriting for work experience needs more work, or experience shall I say. it is still quite unnatural especially for a professional, so I can't really use it just yet
Very much helpful

In general, the interface is user friendly, good set of templates, well working auto formatting. Re possible improvements: AI suggestion is weaker than ChatGPT’s, also would be nice to have a little bit more flexibility on formatting within the chosen template.

Variety of templates, easy to fill template. Professional look. Online link to ready resume for sharingAI is useful but needs more training. GPT is far better.Also ability to adjust margins and tables of frame sizes in edit mode. Thank you

Review.Titre: Buy it and save yourself time and sanity when searching for work
Review.Contenu: I haven't landed a job but I have managed to secure a number of interviews since using Kickresume. Very simple to use and to edit when duplicating CVs for various job roles. It's definitely worth the investment if you're job hunting. Nice user experience plus you can create cover letters in such a short amount of time. Having Kickresume as your 'Go To' CV and Cover Letter writer is a no-brainer. Buy it and use it over and over again.

KickResume is definately the best tool to use if you want your CV to look professional but still interesting. After searching and trying to make my CV on all other sites I am still returning back to KickResume all the time. Only one disappointment - payment options does not work sometimes and can stop you from sending out your newly updated version. Other than that - service and features are perfectly fine.

The tool is a major upgrade if you have been using a simple word processor. I have used it about 2 years earlier and the addition of generative AI is welcome. However, there are only a few templates for the resume and you will quickly run out of options. I end up using two templates. Another surprising weakness is a complete lack of ability to edit the graphical design of the templates, e.g. there are only a few colors you can use, you cannot resize components of the design, you cannot mix the design component between the templates. All these could be easily upgraded by Kickresume.

Review.Titre: Assess the results and effects of using Kickresume
Review.Contenu: I appreciate the analysis feature of the site and the reviews because other AI site like Teal HQ does not analyze your existing resume.I encounter one issue where I was trying to share the website feature with a friend and until now her has not gotten the email from the site.I would suggest maybe making the site cater for the different level of people applying. E.g. someone applying for a Vice president position would not have the same type of resume as someone applying for an entry level position.

Review.Titre: Absolutely made easy to create Resume…
Review.Contenu: Absolutely made easy to create Resume with the help of AI. Suggesting for an improvement that First name and last name font should be adjustable.Also, there is need for Title Below icon where one can include their profession in single line for the recruiter to see it below the name.

Produces quite a professional looking end result. Easy to use. Would be nice to allow for a bit more editing on the layouts or adding the ability to have multiple dates per job experience. A.I needs quite a bit of improvement, but without using it the end result is still worth it. Also price is a bit high compared to competitors, but overall not a bad value.

Using kickresume has been very helpful. The AI resume writing services really polished my resume and it looks so professional. Also, I think its worth the price that I paid. Some Resume apps cost more but do not have the features that kickresume has. The only downside to this app is that it does not have the option of uploading an already existing CV.

A very useful web with many options and smart advice on how to write a better CV/cover letter. I would appraciate though to have some free hand when it comes to CV design. A few small adjustments could be nice, for ex. to be able to size different parts and move them aroud or having the possibility to upload picture to every template (I love one of the templates but unfortunately cannot use it as the picture cannot be added). I would either lower the premium price or work on these little things ;)

I can't thank Kickresume enough. It helped me create some wonderful CVs and Motivation letters. The tool itself is wonderful. However, I think it'd have been great if we could also customize margins to fit more content on one page. It's feature of free passes to two other members is a great way of marketing and as well providing value. Much recommended!

I really love how the formatting is already complete. There’s no rearranging or trying to line portions of your document up. I also really like that there are a number of unique section suggestions and graphs that can be added to a resume. I only wish I had the ability to customization fonts, letter size, spacing, alignment, etc further. Overall, highly recommended.

Review.Titre: Very cool, but I stiil cannot rely only on it
Review.Contenu: Pros:- Nice interface (easy to keep resumes and cover letters organised)- AI does overall a good job- Templates are pretty- Easy to use, creates the resumes fast and easyCons:- AI is not great if I wanna shape the CV to a specific job description (prefer chat GPT instead)- Limited characters for job titles- Limited characters to job descriptions (2,000) if I wanna use the AI to write the cover letter- Unable to exclude the small balls / bars on skills section or change the words (e.g., "Full" is weird for languages, "Native"/"Fluent" would be better) - for me this was the deal breaker that made me go back to Word.

Review.Titre: Mixed bag of positives with a few negatives
Review.Contenu: What I like about Kickresume is the ease of use.  The content generated by their AI needs minimal editing and produces fantastic text. While the content generated by Kickresume is quite good the standard formatting leaves much to be desired.  In my experience Kickresume resumes don't export well.  When trying to open my exported resume in google docs I had to do a lot of work to format the resume that was ultimately in vain.

Review.Titre: It works really well but figuring out…
Review.Contenu: It works really well but figuring out how to upload existing resume or duplicate a version is not intuitive.  I wish there were templates that were not double columns to avoid going to 3 pages.  Unless there’s research that columns work better.  Also the header with my name is way too huge.  I wish that could be modified.  It’s a bit much.  Watch the AI - it likes to overuse words too!  Lol

Review.Titre: Best in the market, with some improvements
Review.Contenu: Glow: Best resume builder by far in the market. The templates are aesthetically pleasing and resume is ready within minutes if you are looking to enhance your current one. Goals: Pricey and AI write-ups could get lengthy.

The tool is awesome, a good resume can be created in minutes and several templates are available increasing the choices.The monthly subscription price looks abit higher.Keep modifying to your best level, it's really helping.

This app is great for starters, and I must say that I had a positive overall experience. The user interface is seamless, and it made the resume creation process incredibly easy. I appreciate how intuitive the platform is, and it saved me a lot of time. However, I did encounter some issues with the add phase function, as it crashed often during my resume creation process. Despite the add phase function crashing, I would still rate Kickresume with four stars. The seamless UI and ease of creating a resume are strong points that shouldn't be overlooked. I would recommend Kickresume to others.

kickresume makes it so easy for you to start, modify, edit, and customize your resume without the stress. Please give kickresume a try and you will not be disappointed.Feature rich and the AI bot is so useful.The best investment you can make for yourself!

Review.Titre: You cannot download the resume in word…
Review.Contenu: You cannot download the resume in word file. You cannot add a title below your name.

Review.Titre: I am fond of the resume templates on…
Review.Contenu: I am fond of the resume templates on this website, for their neat and tasteful design. It was through this website that I composed my own resume, and successfully landed a job. However, with regards to the AI technology implemented, I believe there is still room for more personalization. Some of the suggestions provided may not be suitable for everyone. For my own resume, I employed ChatGPT, which I found to be more adaptable than the template offered here.

Review.Titre: Next level resumes and cover letters
Review.Contenu: Kickresume has taken my already solid resume to the next level. It's also been a tremendous help in building some expertly crafted cover letters that have saved me a ton of time. Great all-round tool!

Great number of templates, updating the job part is messy you should be able to update it in an specific order and not re-write all. When you are uploading the resume to a job app it can’t be read properly. Not sure about the resume and cover letter writing, I have not used it, had bad experiences with other companies in te past.

Overall, a solid service for building a resume. Really appreciate the AI generate content and rewrite content features. Love the number of styles available. Would like to see the ability to add items from a "master" resume so that I don't have to build out each individual resume.

Pros: friendly to edit the CV, many layouts to choose from.Cons: the layouts have some space limitations, so I have to tailor the CV to be shorter in order to fit a one-page model. The AI is very limited so the prompts I get are very mechanical and borderline childish so I don't use it.

Review.Titre: Happy user for the past few months.
Review.Contenu: I have been using this application for about a month now and it's fantastic. The AI writer is a cool addition as well. There are a ton of templates to choose from which is great so I can tailor it to specific clients. I'd like to see a bit more customization from the alignments, spacing and some of the design. For example, the headers don't need to take up a 3rd of the resume.

Review.Titre: I used this website to create my resume…
Review.Contenu: I used this website to create my resume and I was very impressed by the quality and ease of use. The website has a variety of templates and designs to choose from, and it guides you through each step of the process. You can customize your resume to suit your industry and preferences, and download it in different formats. The website also offers tips and advice on how to write a compelling resume and avoid common mistakes. I would highly recommend this website to anyone who needs a professional and attractive resume.

Review.Titre: This site  would  appeal to the …
Review.Contenu: This site  would  appeal to the  average  person in the way that it isvery simply  done, and  everything  is very easy to find.  There is nomessing  around  here, just the  information  that they want to conveypresented in the simplest way possible.  People with no technical background  would  definitely   appreciate  the  simplicity  and  ease  ofnavigation in this site.

I am creating a resume obviously because I need a job. Tried this site because it involved using Artificial Intelligence and I thought that would help make it more professional sounding. My process was to take the paragraph I had written myself and see what AI could do with it. Positive: AI used lots of action words and did make my past employment sound better overall. Negative: Where did the percentages come from!? I have never included any numbers in any of my descriptions, yet AI ended up including % I never entered! My previous employments did not involve sales or measurements. Examples: "I improved sales by 39%." "Customer service satisfaction rose by 13%". Neither of these are true (where did they get those specific percentages from?) and I removed them. While I like the action words, I could have used Bing/Bard to find them. I do like that there are lots of different templates and once you enter your information you can preview all of them. Still learning the site and I haven't created a cover letter yet so let's see what happens! I paid for it and hope to get my money's worth. More specifically a JOB!
Super easy to get an AI generated resume. Much easier to tweak existing text based on your own info, than starting for zero.

Review.Titre: It is a good Application, I think it is continuously becoming better.
Review.Contenu: The Application has some great templates which match the context, text, and layout of your CV. It provides an easy-to-use interface to update the details on your CV, a lot of material can be reworded using AI. There is an analysis meter that provides context into how the CV can be improved.

After being laid-off, I wanted to revamp my resume without spending hours on formatting. Kickresume has been great for creating multiple templates for each job application, and I've kept the subscription so I can easily edit as I continue to apply. I've gotten feedback from many recruiters that they love the easy to read format and how professional the final product looks.

Review.Titre: Solid Resume Creation Tool w/ Lots of Helpful Extras
Review.Contenu: Lots of templates and helpful advice. The video on cover letters is ridiculously informative. Resume creation UI is not as intuitive as it could be, but after using it to create and edit resumes a few times, I've figured everything out.Would be great for someone unfamiliar with creating resumes or someone who knows what they want on a resume and just wants a template to build it on. Great for DIY resumes (i.e. if you don't want to hire a service).

Review.Titre: Good but lacks font sizing control
Review.Contenu: Overall good tool but it does not let the user to change titles’ font sizing or spacing. I understand this is part of the template format but would be great to have more granular control over font sizes.

I love Kick resume! It is quick and efficient way to develop a professional resume. I love the AI tool for writing your resume, it is quick and succinct. I find it hard to logon sometimes, I am not sure if that is because it is because of my location. I will continue to use this program.

I love the AI assistant for the resume and especially the cover letters. I’ve been able to knock out a whole lot of them with the help! I do wish I could save design and content preferences for the cover letters, but this has saved me so much time and headache.

Review.Titre: So easy to use and worth the money
Review.Contenu: so easy to use and worth the money. Very attractive resumes are created. tips and word analytics are also very useful to remove repetitive phases. Only challenge is from india payments with credit cards are an issue. I had to manage via a us friend paying for me. Only for that i cut 1 star.

Review.Titre: Great product that helped me tweak my…
Review.Contenu: Great product that helped me tweak my resume for the next big role.  KickResume can also help with cover letters, websites and resignation letters.  I also found the Kickresume tool to be fair in cost as well.
Provides many options for resume templates. The AI function provides breakdown of constantly used words to allow you to make further changes to enhance the resume.

- Number of provided templates is not a huge variety. and customizing the format of those is not a given option which impacts adversely the experience.- The AI is bringing so generic input and sometimes it is not relevant with the requirement.- The HR audit tools can not properly decode the generated PDF file and believe me that LinkedIn originated  documents are so properly decoded on third party HR sites.- the word version of the documents do not have any format* Given graphic options are limited and no geo related iconsOverall, the tool is promising but the product needs to be improved for the sustainability otherwise the users will not be happy while experience and self-confidence is 2 important keys between the jobs period.

Kickresume is truly a Godsend, it allowed me to clean up my resume with ease and made the process a lot less stressful. I wanted to rate it a 4.5, but that's not an option. I'm confident that the team will continue to improve this.

Great experience using the service, easy and intuitive.  Loved the AI suggestions would like to have more calls per month.  The cover letter templates were good, would like to have placement choices on items like the address and signatures
Super, everyrhing Works fine, maybe to Split each item (CV, cover letter, etc.) Into clearer folder (possibility to adjuest them via date, name etc)
Wonderful platform, full of templates once you pay. It only has some features for English language. It's not cheap but it can save you. More customization is needed.

Review.Titre: Highlight better when is going to be paid
Review.Contenu: I had a good experience on the three times I've used Kickresume. The first ones were in 2020, I had to pay for the premium membership because there are very few free templates and the access to additional info is very limited, but it went well and had no problems with online payment. And the latest was two days ago, when I could subscribe to the premium plan for 10 days  and for free after easily validating my student status. Also the costumer support on the two times I've used was quick and efficient.4 stars because I spent a good amount of time editing my cv only to realize that I couldn't download it for free. Since I was being able to edit it I wasn't really realizing that it wasn't going to be free anymore.

Review.Titre: I have been looking for a tool that can…
Review.Contenu: I have been looking for a tool that can help to use AI for betterment of my resume. I have been delaying the revamp of my Resume from last 2 years and finally when I explored Kick Resume and it is awesome.Couldn't get a better tool.

Review.Titre: It is a great Resume writing app
Review.Contenu: It is a great Resume writing app. The only issue is that is somewhat hard to navigate. I do pay for the premium and I am grateful for the functionality, but I think there are several areas for improvement.

Review.Titre: Im using this for several years as its…
Review.Contenu: Im using this for several years as its a great tool. Ai based suggestion ,profile image,sharerable links are my favorite . over the years It seems templates dont updates.

Easy to use. Looks fabulous that recruiters told me.In my case I don’t have any carrier other than flight attendant job. It was a quite hard to explain and express myself, KICKRESUME Helps me a lot! Thank you 😄

I have used this to (easily) design 3 different TYPES of resumes and customized them quickly. It is a very helpful platform with little confusion or fuss. My only complaint is that the length of the nice designs may exceed 1 page.

Review.Titre: Great designs for CVs and Cover letters
Review.Contenu: The designs and the usability are really great!The build-in AI functionality was not yet very helpful to me but I guess that's going to improve over times.

I'm not a fan, but I understand its significance in the world of quick buck schemes. However, some businesses—Kickresume included—are really enthusiastic about their journey. I've made several resumes for myself and my friends using Kickresume. The best thing is that you get a professionally prepared CV by AI in just five minutes from beginning to end. Later, you can alter it to suit your needs.I advise anyone looking for a quick and effective resume-building experience to use Kickresume. My resume has been greatly improved and looks much more professional thanks to Kickresume's AI resume writing services. I think the cost I paid for it was reasonable given the things it delivers. I do love the auto- review options that give you some metrics on repeated words and other things-  however it would be a great feature if this could have some user settings around location.  I am in Australia and my understanding is that the expectation here is that Resumes should be longer (2-3 pages)- so it often tells me things are too long. (which they may be- but i also think the program is a bit US centric in it's concept of what a "good" resume should have.All and all, even though it is a bit expensive I am glad I purchased a yearly plan.  It's great to know I can very easily create a great looking resume tailored to the position I am applying for- (job hunting is stressful enough without fighting formatting!)I know lots of online advice says to keep resume formatting plain and boring so ATS can read it- but as a designer, that wont work for me.  (I've become a bit annoyed that we've started telling people to design things for machines to read (ATS) rather than for people to read.  This is not the way technology should be working!)

Review.Titre: A great tool & AI assist to make you a better resume writer
Review.Contenu: To be honest, I was leary of yet another AI come-on. But after some research, Kickresume seemed like it should be a reasonable starting point to improve my resume, since I had already maxed out my efforts on a plethora of traditional resume guides. So after I signed up, I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it is to select an appropriate format, even though some were simply cosmetic in nature. The most impressive part was the simple guide format to filling in sections, either from scratch or by importing from an existing resume. The AI system can be used to automatically create content, but it certainly needs editing afterward as it tends to be a little flowery. Overall, it is a great tool, gives you a lot of flexibility and the ability to restart your creative juices and a fresh rewrite.

After about an hour of revisions I had improved my score form 57 to 72.  in the next few hours of review I was able to use the suggestions and add/remove items to get my score to 87.It was also very easy to make multiple versions for spacific roles as well as test out new designs without risk.This is a whole new world of resume management that takes the pain out of the process

It saves my time and sanity during my search by enabling me to create a core resume and then easily make boutique versions, adjusting job titles, SEO words, and sections that fit the role I want to apply for. I am grateful I found KickResume because it has saved me so much time, effort, and stress and I know my resume looks sharp. That enables me to focus more time on searching for opportunities and networking. I recommend this platform to everyone.

Review.Titre: No time to waste: Get that Job
Review.Contenu: It is frustrating to be looking for jobs now a days, not because of the lack of it, but because of the difficulty of getting past those ATS resume checkers to get to HR. I am an educator and have been teaching resume writing. Now, it is not really making any sense to do it yourself when there is an application that can do it for you and does it well in the shortest amount of time. We have to work smart not hard. Kickresume has made it easy to build cover letters and resumes. This is the one application that was easy to use, straightforward, with no hidden agenda behind it but to help. I hate those that help you build your resume but will not release it to you until you pay. That is not the case with Kickresume. I suppose they understand that making a cover letter and resume means you need a job to make money. Until then, you are running on straws. So, there is no time a wasting here. I just wish they existed a long time ago. Well, now that it is here, you can work smart and build your cover letter and resume with Kickresume to hopefully get you through to that interview to land that job.  I have built both my son's and my cover letters and resumes using Kickresume while having coffee in the morning before getting ready for work. Thank you so much Tomas Ondrejka (co-founder of Kickresume).
